item.title: Lots of regular flytipping here, 19th July
item.description:
Every day there is flytipping here - furniture, white goods and miscellaneous rubbish. Could council install a skip or a big bin or something? It’s a shame that it spoils the common space and it’s never ever sorted

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Road, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Public tree dangerous, 19th July
item.description:
I’ve been keeping my eye on the tree outside our house and it’s been progressively leaning further and further to one side and beginning to block the pavement/walkway and it will soon fall down into our front garden and damaging our wall and neighbours car on their driveway. Tree needs to be taken down and a new one planted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shoreham Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste dumped all over Craig’s Court, 19th July
item.description:
Bags plastic buckets food bins full of rubbish litter urine drugs paraphernalia feces - behind the bins in Craig's Court - why is this allowed? reported weeks ago some of the rubbish left here to accumulate - rats circling around... please do something and stop the pubs from adding more rubbish - they should keep their waste inside before collection yet never do just dump outside and nobody cleans anything apart from the council - not very well !? please close it for cleaning at least 1 per year limit and reduce the number of bins / buckets they have and fine those flaunting laws - they profit from dumping and ysing public space for their trade - how can it be acceptable to go on for so long !?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Rainwater Drain, 19th July
item.description:
Blocked Rainwater Drains. Needs Unblocking / Clearing. Corner of Albany Road and Howard Avenue. Causes dangerous surface water, a risk to both pedestrians and road users.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71, Howard Avenue, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole of fellows road and all over Belsize Park, 19th July
item.description:
There are weeds growing all over the pavement. The app is not letting me upload photos but the weeds are unmissable - ugly, obtrusive and ubiquitous. There are sections of fellows road that feel post-apocalyptic. I’m confident Camden is failing in its statutory obligations, because it’s not an isolated incident - they are everywhere.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Fellows Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes in the High Street road., 19th July
item.description:
Large potholes in the 'High Street' road that links up with Station Road. Very jarring on the vehicles. Can these holes and broken tarmac be fixed permanently this time, please? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Star Lane, St Paul's Cray, London
